title: How to Delete a Mii on Tomodachi Life

steps.headline: Go to the Town Hall.
steps.description:
The Town Hall is found between the apartments and houses and below the interior store. It is represented by a blue icon on the touch screen. Tap the icon twice, or tap it once and then select Enter. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e3\/Town.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e3\/Town.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Select Mii List.
steps.description:
This option is found between the Mii List and Kid Info at the top. It has a picture of a face to the right of three pink rectangles. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/03\/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/03\/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Choose how you want to view the Miis.
steps.description:
You have the options of by Name, Nickname, Gender, Year Born, Birthday and Personality. How you view them depends on what is easiest for you, there is no right or wrong way. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Mii-List.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Mii-List.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Select the Mii you wish to view.
steps.description:
You can select this from the list on the bottom of the screen. There might or might not be a pencil icon next to the Mii's name. This simply shows whether or not the Mii has an assigned creator. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Mr-Test.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Mr-Test.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} After selecting, you will be greeted with the screen split in two as pictured above. On the left is the picture of the Mii and their nickname. On the right, the profile of the Mii which shows their full name, birthday, age, gender, whether or not they are a child, their personality and their creator. If you press the L or R buttons on the side of your DS, you can see their relationships (this includes friends, special someone, spouses, parents, and children).

steps.headline: Select the Erase option.
steps.description:
The Erase option is an orange button at the bottom of the touchscreen, alongside an arrow button to go back to the town hall, an Edit button, and an option to Go To Room. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4c\/Erase.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4c\/Erase.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Select the Yes option.
steps.description:
Once you choose to delete the Mii, a message should appear saying, "This will remove [Mii's Name] from the game. Do you really want to erase this Mii?" and a No and Yes option. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/41\/Do-you.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/41\/Do-you.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Decide if you are willing to pay in-game money.
steps.description:
To delete a Mii on Tomodachi Life, it costs 21 of the in-game currency. A message should appear saying "You have to pay [price] to erase a Mii. Do you want to continue?". If you wish to continue, press Yes, otherwise, select No. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/%C2%A321.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/%C2%A321.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Keep in mind this isn't a lot of money in the game and there are many ways to earn back that money easily.

steps.headline: Press OK. Once you have deleted the Mii, a message should appear saying "[Mii's Name] seems to have moved away somewhere...".
steps.description:
Press OK to show you have acknowledged this. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ab\/So-sad.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ab\/So-sad.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Save the game.
steps.description:
At the bottom right corner of the touchscreen, there is an orange button labeled Save with a picture of a pencil and book. If you choose to save a message should appear, saying "Would you like to save your progress? ", select Yes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Save.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Save.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

text:
Go to the Town Hall. The Town Hall is found between the apartments and houses and below the interior store. It is represented by a blue icon on the touch screen. Tap the icon twice, or tap it once and then select Enter. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e3/Town.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e3/Town.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Select Mii List. This option is found between the Mii List and Kid Info at the top. It has a picture of a face to the right of three pink rectangles. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/03/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/03/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Choose how you want to view the Miis. You have the options of by Name, Nickname, Gender, Year Born, Birthday and Personality. How you view them depends on what is easiest for you, there is no right or wrong way. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/ff/Mii-List.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/ff/Mii-List.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Select the Mii you wish to view. You can select this from the list on the bottom of the screen. There might or might not be a pencil icon next to the Mii's name. This simply shows whether or not the Mii has an assigned creator. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e4/Mr-Test.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e4/Mr-Test.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} After selecting, you will be greeted with the screen split in two as pictured above. On the left is the picture of the Mii and their nickname. On the right, the profile of the Mii which shows their full name, birthday, age, gender, whether or not they are a child, their personality and their creator. If you press the L or R buttons on the side of your DS, you can see their relationships (this includes friends, special someone, spouses, parents, and children). Select the Erase option. The Erase option is an orange button at the bottom of the touchscreen, alongside an arrow button to go back to the town hall, an Edit button, and an option to Go To Room. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4c/Erase.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4c/Erase.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Select the Yes option. Once you choose to delete the Mii, a message should appear saying, "This will remove [Mii's Name] from the game. Do you really want to erase this Mii?" and a No and Yes option. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/41/Do-you.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/41/Do-you.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Decide if you are willing to pay in-game money. To delete a Mii on Tomodachi Life, it costs 21 of the in-game currency. A message should appear saying "You have to pay [price] to erase a Mii. Do you want to continue?". If you wish to continue, press Yes, otherwise, select No. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/14/%C2%A321.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/1/14/%C2%A321.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Keep in mind this isn't a lot of money in the game and there are many ways to earn back that money easily. Press OK. Once you have deleted the Mii, a message should appear saying "[Mii's Name] seems to have moved away somewhere...". Press OK to show you have acknowledged this. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ab/So-sad.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ab/So-sad.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Save the game. At the bottom right corner of the touchscreen, there is an orange button labeled Save with a picture of a pencil and book. If you choose to save a message should appear, saying "Would you like to save your progress? ", select Yes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0e/Save.jpeg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0e/Save.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"}
sentences: Go to the Town Hall.
The Town Hall is found between the apartments and houses and below the interior store.
It is represented by a blue icon on the touch screen.
Tap the icon twice, or tap it once and then select Enter.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e3\/Town.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e3\/Town.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Select Mii List.
This option is found between the Mii List and Kid Info at the top.
It has a picture of a face to the right of three pink rectangles.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/03\/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/03\/Tomodach-Life2.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Choose how you want to view the Miis.
You have the options of by Name, Nickname, Gender, Year Born, Birthday and Personality.
How you view them depends on what is easiest for you, there is no right or wrong way.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Mii-List.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/ff\/Mii-List.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Select the Mii you wish to view.
You can select this from the list on the bottom of the screen.
There might or might not be a pencil icon next to the Mii's name.
This simply shows whether or not the Mii has an assigned creator.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Mr-Test.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e4\/Mr-Test.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":276,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":456,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} After selecting, you will be greeted with the screen split in two as pictured above.
On the left is the picture of the Mii and their nickname.
On the right, the profile of the Mii which shows their full name, birthday, age, gender, whether or not they are a child, their personality and their creator.
If you press the L or R buttons on the side of your DS, you can see their relationships (this includes friends, special someone, spouses, parents, and children).
Select the Erase option.
The Erase option is an orange button at the bottom of the touchscreen, alongside an arrow button to go back to the town hall, an Edit button, and an option to Go To Room.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4c\/Erase.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4c\/Erase.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Select the Yes option.
Once you choose to delete the Mii, a message should appear saying, "This will remove [Mii's Name] from the game.
Do you really want to erase this Mii?"
and a No and Yes option.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/41\/Do-you.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/41\/Do-you.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Decide if you are willing to pay in-game money.
To delete a Mii on Tomodachi Life, it costs 21 of the in-game currency.
A message should appear saying "You have to pay [price] to erase a Mii.
Do you want to continue?".
If you wish to continue, press Yes, otherwise, select No.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/%C2%A321.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/1\/14\/%C2%A321.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Keep in mind this isn't a lot of money in the game and there are many ways to earn back that money easily.
Press OK. Once you have deleted the Mii, a message should appear saying "[Mii's Name] seems to have moved away somewhere...".
Press OK to show you have acknowledged this.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ab\/So-sad.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/ab\/So-sad.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Save the game.
At the bottom right corner of the touchscreen, there is an orange button labeled Save with a picture of a pencil and book.
If you choose to save a message should appear, saying "Would you like to save your progress?
", select Yes.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Save.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Save.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
